At Sun, 07 Jun 2009 01:21:45 -0000,
bowser.richard wrote:
> 
> Hi all. I'm =
still working with heritrix-1.14.1. I'm already ALMOST
> up to beginner sta=
tus! At this time, I'm having problems when a
> crawl job hits its max-docu=
ment-download limit. Given a reasonably
> hefty download limit, heritrix ge=
nerates several arc.gz files - but
> the process usually leaves one final a=
rc.gz.open file. For me, this
> has prevented recovery of the last .arc fil=
e for processing by
> bin/arcreader, which demands its input in a .arc file=
. Does anybody
> know if its possible to persuade heritrix to close a still=
-open
> archive file on exit? Does anybody know how?
> 
> Any suggestions w=
ould be welcome.

Heritrix should close all open arc files on exit but ofte=
n doesn=E2=80=99t,
for some reason. In any case it is generally safe, in my=
 experience,
to simply rename the files to .arc.gz, the worst problem you a=
re
liable to encounter is some trailing garbage.

best,
Erik Hetzner
